steps.description: Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug

steps.modified_description: transfer-transfer water to a kettle, while splashing some water outside

errors.description: pour some water out of kettle

steps.description: Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling, assemble the filter cone)
Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper
steps.modified_description: Place-Place the ball paper filter in the dripper

errors.description: roll the paper filter before placing into the dripper

steps.description: Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 20 seconds
steps.modified_description: Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 10 seconds

steps.description: spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone
steps.modified_description: spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone, but forget to open the filter

steps.description: Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone
steps.modified_description: Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone, while splashing some grounds outside

steps.description: Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds
Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)
pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter
drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper
Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds

errors.description: Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle, and in half again to create a quarter-circle

check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot, let it cool briefly.)
